content: **fuggle s critmas dice bag** a very simple highly customisable treasure bag to be used for dice or other treasures i ve gifted all my hand knitted socks in these this year and have one for my backpack for my face mask nifty a gift from one critter to another perfect for critmas inspired by the need to whip up a gift very quickly this can be knitted using any yarn you like we re holding three strands of yarn together here but you could use anything you re comfortable knitting with 4mm needles…of course you can change that too cast on is with a crochet hook it gives a lovely texture a little extra weight and bonus saves our wrists on those tiny circumferences *who s fuggle you ask * fuggle is a halfling a short but stout halfling fuggle has medium brown hair quite the beard and is particularly good at hiding you can find fuggle living in the woods with his brewing supplies at the foot of the highland mountains of his homeland fuggle is partial to a good ale in the local tavern preferably in the company of his adventuring friends if you should come across fuggle you ll certainly notice he s always got his pouch of hops at his side **recommended yarn ** hold **3** of your fingering weight yarns together use stash advent minis minis scraps **yardage ** main colour holding three strands together without a tie 32 ** 42 ** 56 g / 117 ** 154 ** 205 m / 128 ** 168 ** 224 yds **allow 1 5g for a tie 0 5g of each colour ** *yardage is estimated however you could probably get a small bag from 3 10g minis yardage may vary depending on yarn choice gauge variations or modifications * **recommended needles ** 4 mm us 6 dpns or cable circular needles in suitable length for your preferred method of working short circumferences in the round e g 60 cm / 24 inch cable for magic loop optional 4 mm us 6 40 cm / 16 inch cable circular needles or suitable length for your preferred method of working small circumference in the round **gauge ** 5 5 sts and 8 row over 1 inch by 1 inch / 2 5 cm by 2 5 cm in stockinette **notions ** 4 mm us g-6 crochet hook stitch markers cable needle tapestry needle to weave in ends thank you for supporting independent design for pattern support you can contact the designer at heatherandhopstv@gmail com follow me on instagram @heather hops share your finished objects and see others on social media with the tags #heatherandhops and #fugglesdicebag #critmasdicebag please please do not reproduce or sell items that are knitted from this pattern without permission this has *not* been tech edited please do let me know of any errors and i will update as soon as i can
